metadata.title: CVE-2024-26679 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: inet:read sk->sk_family once in inet_recv_error() inet_recv_error() is calledwithout holding the socket lock. IPv6 socket could mutate to IPv4 withIPV6_ADDRFORM socket option and trigger a KCSAN warning.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-258.292
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
